trial_identification.studytitle: Cost-effectiveness of weight loss for type 2 diabetics: a randomised controlled trial of LapBand placement
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Cost-effectiveness of weight loss for type 2 diabetics: a randomised controlled trial of LapBand placement

interventions.interventions: The intervention was placement of a LapBand in patients to folow them and see how much weight they lose. The LapBand procedure takes approximately 30 minutes. The control did not recieve a LapBand. Weight loss was measured by weight lost in kilograms and BMI lost, as well as blood measurements. This trial went for 12 months. An economic analysis of in terms of a cost-effectiveness analysis will be implemented in this phase. This will involve an estimation of costs associated with both groups (eg., Cost of the Lapband procedure etc)
interventions.comparator: THe control group did not recieve a LapBand, they recieved normal medical care.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Weight loss: change in weight in kilograms and BMI
primaryOutcome.timepoint: fortnightly at timepoints up to 2 yrs

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Cost effectiveness. Estimation by economist of QALYs DALYs etc after a consideration of costs of surgery, aftercare etc

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to conduct an economic analysis involving a cost-effectiveness analysis of a previous randomised controlled trial of weight loss for type 2 diabetics with LapBand placement, involving an estimation of costs associated with both groups.
